item.title: 菲律宾经济增长因贪污丑闻跌至四年来最低点
item.description: 由于腐败丑闻引发抗议、打击投资者情绪并导致官员在关键项目上踩刹车，菲律宾第三季度经济增长大幅减速，低于所有经济学家的预期。比索下跌。【原文：The Philippines’ growth dramatically decelerated in the third quarter, missing all economist estimates, as a corruption scandal triggered protests, hurt investor sentiment and led officials to hit the brakes on key projects. The peso fell.】

item.title: 交易员权衡疲弱的美国就业数据和美联储言论，黄金走势平稳
item.description: 黄金持稳，原因是交易商在出人意料地疲软的美国就业数据与美联储官员抑制进一步降息预期的言论之间取得了平衡。【原文：Gold held steady as traders balanced surprisingly weak US employment data with comments from a Federal Reserve official that dampened expectations for further interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 欧洲央行武契奇称政策状况良好，警告市场风险
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员鲍里斯-武伊契奇重申了他的观点，即当前的政策 "处于一个良好的位置"，并补充说，在将通胀率降至欧洲中央银行的目标而没有引发经济衰退之后，"我们觉得我们已经完成了自己的工作"。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Boris Vujcic repeated his view that current policy is “in a good place,” adding that “we feel that we have done our job” after lowering inflation to the ECB’s target without provoking a recession.】

item.title: Recruit 因人力资源强劲增长而创下上市以来最大涨幅
item.description: Recruit Holdings Co. 自 2014 年上市以来涨幅最大，此前该公司公布的盈利强于预期，并因人力资源技术业务的强劲增长而上调了业绩预期。【原文：Recruit Holdings Co. gained the most since its 2014 listing, after it reported stronger-than-expected earnings and raised its forecast on robust growth in human resources technology business.】

item.title: 欧盟森林法实施后，印尼将目光投向非洲北部的农场出口
item.description: 据一位高级政府官员称，印度尼西亚正在为其小规模咖啡和可可种植者寻找包括北非在内的新市场，因为根据欧盟新的森林砍伐规定，这些种植者有可能失去进入欧盟市场的机会。【原文：Indonesia is scouting fresh markets including North Africa for its small-scale coffee and cocoa farmers at risk of losing access to the European Union under the bloc’s new deforestation rules, according to a senior government official.】

item.title: 马来西亚林吉特升至 13 个月高点，因降息预期减弱，增长前景黯淡
item.description: 由于对央行降息的预期减弱，以及对经济增长的乐观情绪重燃，马来西亚林吉特升至一年多来最强。【原文：The Malaysian ringgit gained to the strongest in more than a year on fading expectations for a central bank interest-rate cut and by renewed optimism over growth.】

item.title: 尽管通胀受到冲击，日本家庭仍在增加支出
item.description: 日本家庭支出连续第五个月增长，为分析师认为第三季度萎缩但低于预期的经济提供了一些支撑。【原文：Japan’s household spending rose for a fifth month, providing some support for an economy that analysts say contracted in the third quarter, but coming in below expectations.】

item.title: 各州数据显示美国上周初请失业金人数上升
item.description: 彭博新闻社（Bloomberg News）对联邦政府停摆期间公布的未经调整的州一级申请数据进行的分析显示，上周美国失业救济金申请人数有所增加。【原文：Applications for US unemployment benefits rose last week, according to a Bloomberg News analysis of unadjusted state-level filings released during the federal government shutdown.】

item.title: 大宗商品疲软，麦格理利润不及预期
item.description: 麦格理集团（Macquarie Group Ltd.）的利润低于预期，原因是该澳大利亚金融巨头的主要大宗商品和全球市场业务不温不火，抵消了投资银行业务的反弹。【原文：Macquarie Group Ltd.’s profit fell short of expectations as tepid activity at its key commodities and global markets division offset a rebound in investment banking at the Australian finance giant.】

item.description: 双线资本（DoubleLine Capital）的罗伯特-科恩（Robert Cohen）认为，固定收益投资者在为人工智能热潮提供资金时应谨慎行事。【原文：Fixed-income investors should tread carefully when it comes to funding the artificial intelligence boom, according to DoubleLine Capital’s Robert Cohen.】

item.title: 美国十亿美元级 IPO 数量远远落后于私募融资
item.description: 由于公开市场难以吸引快速成长的人工智能初创企业和有抱负的科技巨头，私营公司正以数十亿美元的融资速度从投资者手中筹集资金，其速度快于那些选择在美国进行类似规模首次公开募股的公司。【原文：Private companies are raising funds from investors in multibillion-dollar rounds at a quicker pace than those opting for similarly sized US IPOs, as public markets struggle to attract fast-growing artificial intelligence startups and aspiring-tech giants.】

item.title: 选举冲击凸显电费成为新的政治风险
item.description: 民主党人在竞选中承诺降低公用事业费，本周在新泽西州、弗吉尼亚州和佐治亚州的关键选举中大获全胜，种种迹象表明，飞涨的电费将成为明年美国国会中期选举的关键因素。【原文：Democrats campaigning on a promise to lower utility bills swept key elections in New Jersey, Virginia and Georgia this week, and all signs suggest skyrocketing electricity rates will be pivotal in US congressional midterms next year.】

item.title: 预计 2025 年美国假日消费将超过 1 万亿美元
item.description: 据美国全国零售联合会预测，尽管消费者持谨慎态度，但今年的假日消费将超过 1 万亿美元，并创下历史纪录。【原文：Holiday spending will surpass $1 trillion this year and set a record despite consumer caution, according to a forecast by the National Retail Federation.】

item.title: 奥特曼称 OpenAI 不希望政府为人工智能提供救助
item.description: OpenAI 首席执行官山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）反驳了该公司将寻求联邦担保以降低其人工智能基础设施支出风险的说法，而在此前一天，该聊天 GPT 制造商的一位高管曾表示，政府可能会在帮助该技术融资方面发挥作用。【原文：OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman pushed back at the idea that the company would seek federal guarantees to reduce the risk of its AI infrastructure spending spree, one day after a top executive at the ChatGPT maker suggested there may be a role for the government to help finance the technology.】
